alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Person (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 30 at 10:18PM EDT until October 01 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance, Chatham, Davidson, Durham, Forsyth, Franklin, Granville, Guilford, Halifax, Harnett, Johnston, Lee, Montgomery, Moore, Nash, Orange, Person, Randolph, Stanly, Vance, Wake and Warren. * WHEN...Until 9 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Hurricane Ian will continue to generate periods of rain across the region through tonight, with 3 to 5 inches of rain expected. Local amounts to 6 inches are also possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
